root.title: Potential Network Sniffing Activity Using Network Tools
root.description: Detects potential network sniffing via use of network tools such as "tshark", "windump". Network sniffing refers to using the network interface on a system to monitor or capture information sent over a wired or wireless connection. An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.
root.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

falsepositives.item: Legitimate administration activity to troubleshoot network issues
